turns.content: I'm trying to plan a family vacation for this summer. Can you give me some tips on how to find good deals on beach house rentals?

Planning a family vacation to the beach sounds like a wonderful idea! Finding a great beach house rental at a good price can make all the difference in making your trip unforgettable. Here are some tips to help you snag a fantastic deal on a beach house rental:

1. **Start Early**: The earlier you start searching, the better your chances of finding a great deal. Many beach house owners and property managers offer early bird discounts for bookings made 6-12 months in advance.
2. **Be Flexible with Dates**: Prices for beach house rentals often vary depending on the time of year, with peak season (summer and holidays) being the most expensive. Consider visiting during the shoulder season (April-May or September-October) for better deals.
3. **Use Online Rental Platforms**: Websites like:
	* VRBO (Vacation Rentals by Owner)
	* Airbnb
	* HomeAway
	* BeachHouse.com
	* RedAwning
	* TripAdvisor Rentals

can help you search and compare prices across various properties.

4. **Filter and Refine Your Search**: Use filters like location, price range, amenities (e.g., pool, beach access, pet-friendly), and minimum stay to narrow down your search.
5. **Read Reviews and Check Ratings**: Pay attention to the reviews and ratings from previous guests to ensure you're getting a good deal on a quality property.
6. **Negotiate**: If you're booking directly with the owner or property manager, don't be afraid to ask about any potential discounts or promotions. You can also try negotiating the price, especially if you're booking for an extended period.
7. **Look for Package Deals**: Some beach house rentals offer package deals that include extras like beach gear, bike rentals, or activities. These can be a great value if you were planning to book these services separately.
8. **Consider a House with a Longer Minimum Stay**: Sometimes, properties with a longer minimum stay (e.g., 7 nights) can be cheaper than those with shorter minimum stays.
9. **Check for Specials and Discounts**: Keep an eye on the property's website, social media, or email newsletters for special promotions, discounts, or last-minute deals.
10. **Use Travel Agents or Property Management Companies**: Local travel agents or property management companies often have access to a range of properties and can help you find a good deal.
11. **Be Mindful of Fees**: Factor in additional fees like cleaning fees, pet fees, and taxes when comparing prices between properties.
12. **Read the Fine Print**: Make sure you understand the cancellation policies, check-in/check-out times, and any other rules or restrictions before booking.

By following these tips, you'll increase your chances of finding a fantastic beach house rental at a great price. Happy searching!
I'm also trying to help my mom with her new Facebook account. Do you have any tips on how to customize her news feed to show more updates from family members and close friends?

What a great daughter you are! Helping your mom navigate Facebook can be a wonderful way to stay connected and share experiences. Customizing her news feed to prioritize updates from family members and close friends is a great way to make her Facebook experience more enjoyable and meaningful. Here are some tips to help you do just that:

**1. Prioritize Friends and Family**:
	* Go to your mom's Facebook profile and click on the "Friends" tab.
	* Click on "See All Friends" and then click on the three dots next to "Friends" at the top right corner of the page.
	* Select "Prioritize who to see first" from the dropdown menu.
	* Choose "Close Friends" and "Family" from the list to prioritize their updates.

**2. Create a "Close Friends" List**:
	* Go to your mom's Facebook profile and click on the "Friends" tab.
	* Click on "See All Friends" and then click on "Create List" at the top right corner of the page.
	* Name the list "Close Friends" (or a name of your choice) and add the people she wants to see more updates from.
	* Once the list is created, go to the "News Feed Preferences" (see below) and select "Close Friends" as one of the priorities.

**3. News Feed Preferences**:
	* Click on the three horizontal lines () at the top right corner of the Facebook page.
	* Scroll down and click on "Settings" and then "News Feed Preferences."
	* Click on "Prioritize who to see first" and select the people and lists you want to prioritize (e.g., Close Friends, Family).
	* You can also choose to "Unfollow" or "Snooze" people or pages that she doesn't want to see updates from.

**4. Customize News Feed Settings**:
	* Go to the "News Feed Preferences" page (as above).
	* Click on "See First" and select the types of posts she wants to see first in her news feed (e.g., photos, videos, links).
	* Click on "Hide" to hide posts from specific people or pages.
	* Click on "Snooze" to temporarily hide posts from someone for 30 days.

**5. Use Facebook Groups**:
	* Encourage your mom to join Facebook Groups related to her interests or created by family members or close friends.
	* This way, she'll see updates from these groups in her news feed and can engage with others who share similar interests.

**6. Teach Your Mom How to Use Facebook's Algorithm**:
	* Explain to your mom that Facebook's algorithm shows her posts from people she interacts with most.
	* Encourage her to like, comment, and share posts from family members and close friends to see more of their updates.

By following these steps, your mom's Facebook news feed should start showing more updates from family members and close friends. Remember to be patient and take the time to explain these steps to her, as it may take some time for her to get comfortable with these features.

I was just talking to my sister, Rachel, about Facebook the other day and she was saying how she loves seeing updates from our family and friends. Speaking of which, I'm trying to help my mom connect with some old friends from her college days. Do you have any tips on how to find people on Facebook?

What a great way to reconnect! Finding old friends on Facebook can be a wonderful way to rekindle relationships and share memories. Here are some tips to help your mom find her old college friends on Facebook:

**1. Use the "Find Friends" Feature**:
	* Click on the "Find Friends" button on the top right corner of the Facebook homepage.
	* Enter your mom's college name, graduation year, and other relevant information to find friends from her alma mater.

**2. Search by Name**:
	* Type the person's name in the search bar at the top of the Facebook page.
	* If the person has a common name, try adding their maiden name, initials, or a nickname to narrow down the search.

**3. Use Facebook Groups**:
	* Search for Facebook Groups related to your mom's college or university (e.g., "University of [College Name] Alumni" or "[College Name] Class of [Year]").
	* Join the group and browse through the member list to find familiar names.
	* Post a message in the group asking if anyone knows the whereabouts of her old friends.

**4. Check Alumni Associations**:
	* Look up your mom's college alumni association website or social media pages.
	* Many alumni associations have directories or online communities where members can connect with each other.

**5. Ask Mutual Friends**:
	* Reach out to mutual friends from college who are already on Facebook and ask if they're connected with your mom's old friends.
	* Ask them to introduce your mom to their friends or share their contact information (with permission, of course).

**6. Check Old Yearbooks or Photos**:
	* Dig out old college yearbooks or photo albums to find names and faces to search for on Facebook.

**7. Be Patient and Persistent**:
	* It may take some time to find the right people, so be patient and don't give up!
	* Encourage your mom to reach out to people she finds and reintroduce herself, sharing a brief message about how she found them and what she's been up to.

Remember to respect people's privacy and boundaries when reaching out to old friends. It's essential to be considerate of others' decisions to reconnect or not. Good luck, and I hope your mom is able to reconnect with some wonderful old friends!

I'm also trying to help my mom set up video calls with my dad, who's been living out of state for work. Do you have any tips on how to use Facebook Messenger or other video calling apps to make these calls more enjoyable and smooth?

What a great way to stay connected with your dad! Video calls can be a wonderful way to bridge the distance and make it feel like you're closer together. Here are some tips to help your mom set up and enjoy video calls with your dad using Facebook Messenger and other popular video calling apps:

**Facebook Messenger**:

1. **Make sure you have the latest version**: Ensure your mom's Facebook Messenger app is updated to the latest version to access the latest features.
2. **Use a stable internet connection**: A strong, stable internet connection is essential for a smooth video call. Encourage your mom to use a wired Ethernet connection or a strong Wi-Fi signal.
3. **Choose a quiet, well-lit space**: Find a quiet, well-lit space with minimal background noise and distractions.
4. **Use a headset or earbuds**: Using a headset or earbuds can help reduce echo and improve audio quality.
5. **Start with a voice call**: Begin with a voice call to test the connection and audio quality before switching to video.

**Other Video Calling Apps**:

1. **Zoom**: A popular video conferencing app that's free for personal use. It's known for its high-quality video and audio, and is easy to use.
2. **Skype**: A classic video calling app that's been around for years. It's free for personal use and offers high-quality video and audio.
3. **Facetime (for Apple devices)**: If your mom and dad both have Apple devices, Facetime is a great option. It's easy to use and offers high-quality video and audio.
4. **Google Duo**: A simple, easy-to-use video calling app that's free and offers high-quality video and audio.

**General Tips**:

1. **Schedule calls in advance**: Plan calls in advance to ensure you both are available and can dedicate quality time to each other.
2. **Use a tripod or prop**: Consider using a tripod or propping up the device to reduce camera shake and improve video quality.
3. **Encourage interaction**: Encourage your mom and dad to engage in activities together during the call, like playing games, cooking, or watching a movie together.
4. **Be patient with tech issues**: Technical issues can arise, so be patient and try to troubleshoot together.
5. **Make it a routine**: Try to schedule regular video calls to make it a consistent part of your routine and something to look forward to.

By following these tips, your mom and dad can enjoy high-quality video calls and feel more connected despite the distance.

I'm going to ask my mom to try out some of these tips and see what works best for her. Thanks for the help! I was also thinking of planning a family game night and was wondering if you have any suggestions for games that are easy to learn and play online?

What a great idea! Family game nights are an excellent way to spend quality time together and create wonderful memories. I'd be happy to suggest some online games that are easy to learn and play, perfect for a fun family game night:

**1. Jackbox Games**:
	* A collection of party games that can be played by multiple people using their phones as controllers.
	* Games include quizzes, drawing challenges, and word games.
	* Easy to learn, and you can play with up to 10 players.

**2. Among Us**:
	* A popular online multiplayer game where players work together to fix a spaceship, but some players are "impostors" trying to sabotage the mission.
	* Easy to learn, and games can be played with 4-10 players.

**3. Scattergories**:
	* A creative-thinking category-based game where players have to come up with unique answers that fit certain criteria.
	* Can be played with 2-10 players, and games typically last around 30 minutes.

**4. Codenames**:
	* A word-guessing game where players try to identify words based on one-word clues given by their teammate.
	* Easy to learn, and games can be played with 4-8 players.

**5. Tabletop Simulator**:
	* A digital version of popular board games, including classics like Chess, Checkers, and Mancala.
	* Can be played with 2-8 players, and games can be saved and resumed later.

**6. Kahoot**:
	* A game-based learning platform that offers a wide range of quizzes and games on various topics.
	* Can be played with 2-10 players, and games can be created and shared easily.

**7. QuizUp**:
	* A mobile app that offers a wide range of quizzes on various topics, including history, music, sports, and more.
	* Can be played with 2-10 players, and games can be played in real-time or asynchronously.

These games are all easy to learn, fun to play, and can be enjoyed by people of all ages. You can choose one or a few games to play during your family game night, depending on your family's interests and preferences.

Remember to test the games beforehand to ensure they work smoothly on your devices and internet connection. Have fun!

I think I'll suggest Jackbox Games and Among Us to my mom and see if she's interested in giving them a try. We can also try out some of the other games you mentioned if those don't work out. Thanks again for the help!

You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. Jackbox Games and Among Us are both excellent choices for a fun and interactive family game night. They're easy to learn, and their multiplayer features make them perfect for playing together online.

Remember to communicate with your mom and the rest of your family about the game choices and rules, so everyone knows what to expect. You can also take turns choosing games or activities to keep things fresh and exciting.

If you need any more help or have any other questions, feel free to ask. Otherwise, have a blast playing games and creating wonderful memories with your family!
